content:
That's a great approach! Focusing on keywords with medium search volume and lower competition can help you drive more targeted traffic to your website and increase your chances of converting visitors into customers.

It's fantastic that you're feeling inspired and motivated after attending the digital marketing conference in Las Vegas! Conferences like that can be a great way to learn from industry experts, network with like-minded professionals, and get energized to take your business to the next level.

To help you stay focused and on track, I recommend creating a keyword research template or spreadsheet to organize your findings. This will enable you to:

1. Track your target keywords and their corresponding search volume, competition, and relevance.
2. Analyze your competitors and identify gaps in the market.
3. Prioritize your keywords based on their potential and feasibility.
4. Develop a content strategy that targets your top keywords and resonates with your audience.

Here's a simple template you can use to get started:

| Keyword | Search Volume | Competition (KD) | Relevance | Priority | Content Idea |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [Keyword 1] | [Search Volume] | [KD Score] | [Relevance Score] | [High/Medium/Low] | [Content Idea] |
| [Keyword 2] | [Search Volume] | [KD Score] | [Relevance Score] | [High/Medium/Low] | [Content Idea] |
| ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... |

Remember to regularly review and update your template as you continue to research and optimize your keywords.

What's the next step you plan to take in your SEO journey? Are you going to start creating content around your target keywords, or do you need help with developing a content strategy?
